questions.question: His jokes fell ………………………….
questions.description: If something falls flat it fails to produce the intended result.

questions.question: When his friend was in trouble, he took up the …………………………… on his behalf.
questions.description: To take up the cudgels is to defend or support somebody.

questions.question: By endorsing that forged document, he cut his own ……………………….
questions.description: To cut your own throat is to behave in a way that will cause harm to you.

questions.question: Once she entered the show business she seemed to carry all ………………………. her.
questions.description: To carry all before one is to be completely successful.

questions.question: It is always bad manners to …………………………… over your opponent.
questions.description: To crow over is to exult loudly.

questions.question: Her beauty took my ……………………………. away.
questions.description: When something takes your breath away you are very much surprised by it.

questions.question: Parental property is the ………………………………. of contention between the brothers.
questions.description: The bone of contention is the cause of dispute.

questions.question: When I met him at the party, he cut me ……………………………
questions.description: To cut someone dead is to insult them by ignoring them deliberately.

questions.question: There is no harm in using social media, but you must draw the ………………………….. somewhere.
questions.description: To draw the line is to fix the limits.

questions.question: My wife and I do not always …………………………….
questions.description: To see eye to eye is to agree with.

questions.question: He lost the game but put a brave ……………………………… on it.
questions.description: To put a brave face on something is to accept an unpleasant experience courageously.

questions.question: He is a far …………………………… from his idealistic brother.
questions.description: To be a far cry is to be very different.
